title: datalad push --data nothing doesn't push the annex branch

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
We're pushing a dataset into a RIA store without a storage sibling (``bulk1``). We try to be explicit about not pushing data in the script, and hence add ``--data nothing`` to ``datalad push``.
However, a `datalad push --to bulk1 --data nothing` only pushes ``master``:

```
$ datalad push --to bulk1 --data nothing
# refs in RIA store only have master, not git annex:
$ ls /data/project/ukb_vbm/dsstore/156/28c7a-d1af-11ea-bbf2-ac1f6b8b1606/refs/heads 
master

# git-annex branch is only pushed without --data nothing
$ datalad push --to bulk1
$ ls /data/project/ukb_vbm/dsstore/65d/fd6d4-d1b0-11ea-9471-b4969146869c/refs/heads
git-annex  master
```

Given the documentation,

```
       --data {anything|nothing|auto|auto-if-wanted}
              what to do with (annex'ed) data. 'anything' would cause transfer of all annexed content, 'nothing'
              would avoid call to `git annex copy` altogether. 'auto' would use 'git annex copy'  with  '--auto'
              thus  transferring  only  data which would satisfy "wanted" or "numcopies" settings for the remote
              (thus "nothing" otherwise). 'auto-if-wanted' would enable '--auto' mode only if there is a  "want‐
              ed"  setting  for the remote, and transfer 'anything' otherwise. Constraints: value must be one of
              ('anything', 'nothing', 'auto', 'auto-if-wanted') [Default: 'auto-if-wanted']
```

I would expect that the annex branch should be pushed nevertheless.
